projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Received One Hundred and eighty four dollars and Fifty cents in part of the within
William Blount Governer in and over the Territory of the United States south of the river Ohio
To David Henley Esquire Agent for the Department of war

Pay to Willian Rickard Pay-Master pro tem to the Troops in the Territory aforesaid one hundred and ninety eight dollars out of the money in your hands appropriated for the defensive protection of the frontiers for the pay of a Detachment of Mounted Infantry of Miro District Col James Ford's Regiment under the command of Sargeant William Johnston from the eighteenth November to the fith December 1794, agreeably to payroll and your report thereon of this date, for which this shall be your warrant
Given at Knoxville under my hand and seal this 20th day of July 1795
